page.title: 03HEALTH-SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: Sewage is composed of four main constituents- 1: Sewage from householder (eg. toilets ,washing etc...) This amounts to 250 litres per person per day 2: Waste waters from industry . 3: Water that infiltrates the sewers 4: Surface water-ie. rainwater from roads . Sewage is normally 90% water . Sewage is firstly treated physically to remove settleable solids .The stages are screening ,grit removal, primary settling and removal of sludge by tanker for dumping at sea . Sewage is now introduced onto slag and is converted by bacteria and oxidised . A final settling tank removes the suspended solids left and the clean water proceeds into Auldhouse Burn .
